text: The Gospel of Matthew begins with what?
options: The birth of John the Baptist
The genealogy of Jesus, tracing back to Abraham
verseText: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham. Abraham was the father of Isaac...

text: Matthew's Gospel emphasizes Jesus as the fulfillment of prophecies concerning whom?
options: The promised Messiah and King from David's line
verseText: (Matthew frequently quotes Old Testament prophecies, presenting Jesus as the promised King, the 'Son of David').

text: What major block of Jesus' teaching is found in Matthew chapters 5-7?
verseText: Seeing the crowds, he went up on the mountain, and when he sat down, his disciples came to him. And he opened his mouth and taught them, saying...

text: Who visited the young child Jesus in Matthew's account, following a star?
verseText: Now after Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem, saying, “Where is he who has been born king of the Jews? For we saw his star when it rose and have come to worship him.”

text: What is the 'Great Commission' given by Jesus at the end of Matthew's Gospel?
options: To make disciples of all nations, baptizing and teaching them
verseText: Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, teaching them to observe all that I have commanded you. And behold, I am with you always, to the end of the age.”

text: Matthew often uses the phrase 'Kingdom of...' instead of 'Kingdom of God'.
verseText: (Matthew, likely writing for a Jewish audience respectful of using God's name, frequently uses 'Kingdom of Heaven' where other Gospels use 'Kingdom of God').

text: Which disciple walks on water towards Jesus but begins to sink due to doubt (Matthew 14)?
verseText: And Peter answered him, “Lord, if it is you, command me to come to you on the water.” He said, “Come.” So Peter got out of the boat and walked on the water and came to Jesus. But when he saw the wind, he was afraid, and beginning to sink he cried out, “Lord, save me.”

text: Matthew 16 contains Peter's confession of Jesus as the Christ and Jesus' subsequent prediction of what?
options: The coming of the Holy Spirit
verseText: Simon Peter replied, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”... From that time Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things... and be killed, and on the third day be raised.

text: The parables of the Ten Virgins and the Talents are part of which discourse in Matthew?
verseText: (These parables focusing on readiness for the Lord's return are part of the Olivet Discourse concerning the end times).

text: What unique event does Matthew record happening immediately after Jesus' death?
options: An earthquake, rocks splitting, and tombs opening with resurrected saints appearing
The sky turning black for three days
verseText: And behold, the curtain of the temple was torn in two, from top to bottom. And the earth shook, and the rocks were split. The tombs also were opened. And many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised, and coming out of the tombs after his resurrection they went into the holy city and appeared to many.

text: How did Joseph, Mary's husband, initially react to finding out Mary was pregnant?
options: He decided to divorce her quietly
verseText: And her husband Joseph, being a just man and unwilling to put her to shame, resolved to divorce her quietly.

text: What message did the angel give Joseph in a dream regarding Mary's pregnancy?
options: That the child was conceived by the Holy Spirit and he should name him Jesus
verseText: But as he considered these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, “Joseph, son of David, do not fear to take Mary as your wife, for that which is conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit. She will bear a son, and you shall call his name Jesus, for he will save his people from their sins.”

text: What does the name 'Emmanuel', mentioned in Matthew 1, mean?
verseText: “Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a son, and they shall call his name Immanuel” (which means, God with us).

text: Why did Joseph take Mary and Jesus to Egypt (Matthew 2)?
options: To escape King Herod's plot to kill the child
verseText: Now when they had departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream and said, “Rise, take the child and his mother, and flee to Egypt, and remain there until I tell you, for Herod is about to search for the child, to destroy him.”

text: What tragic event occurred in Bethlehem after the Magi departed (Matthew 2)?
options: The massacre of male infants ordered by Herod
verseText: Then Herod, when he saw that he had been tricked by the wise men, became furious, and he sent and killed all the male children in Bethlehem and in all that region who were two years old or under...

text: Who prepared the way for Jesus, preaching repentance in the wilderness of Judea (Matthew 3)?
verseText: In those days John the Baptist came preaching in the wilderness of Judea, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.”

text: What happened immediately after Jesus was baptized by John (Matthew 3)?
options: The heavens opened, the Spirit descended like a dove, and a voice from heaven spoke
verseText: And when Jesus was baptized, immediately he went up from the water, and behold, the heavens were opened to him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and coming to rest on him; and behold, a voice from heaven said, “This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased.”

text: How did Jesus respond to Satan's temptations in the wilderness (Matthew 4)?
verseText: But he answered, “It is written, “‘Man shall not live by bread alone...’” Jesus said to him, “Again it is written, “‘You shall not put the Lord your God to the test.’” Then Jesus said to him, “Be gone, Satan! For it is written, “‘You shall worship the Lord your God and him only shall you serve.’”

text: Who were the first four disciples Jesus called by the Sea of Galilee (Matthew 4)?
options: Philip, Bartholomew, Thaddaeus, Simon the Zealot
verseText: While walking by the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon (who is called Peter) and Andrew his brother... And going on from there he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee and John his brother...

text: The Beatitudes (Matthew 5:3-12) begin with 'Blessed are the...'
verseText: “Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

text: In the Sermon on the Mount, Jesus compares his followers to what two things that influence the world (Matthew 5)?
verseText: “You are the salt of the earth... You are the light of the world.

text: Jesus states in Matthew 5 that he came not to abolish the Law or the Prophets, but to do what?
verseText: “Do not think that I have come to abolish the Law or the Prophets; I have not come to abolish them but to fulfill them.

text: In Matthew 5, Jesus intensifies the command 'You shall not murder' by saying that even what is subject to judgment?
verseText: “You have heard that it was said to those of old, ‘You shall not murder...’ But I say to you that everyone who is angry with his brother will be liable to judgment...

text: What instruction does Jesus give regarding oaths in Matthew 5?
options: Let your 'yes' be 'yes' and your 'no' be 'no'; do not swear at all
verseText: But I say to you, Do not take an oath at all... Let what you say be simply ‘Yes’ or ‘No’; anything more than this comes from evil.

text: How does Jesus tell his followers to respond to enemies in Matthew 5?
options: Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you
verseText: But I say to you, Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you,

text: In Matthew 6, Jesus warns against practicing righteousness (like giving, praying, fasting) in what way?
verseText: “Beware of practicing your righteousness before other people in order to be seen by them, for then you will have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.

text: What model prayer does Jesus teach his disciples in Matthew 6?
verseText: Pray then like this: “Our Father in heaven, hallowed be your name. Your kingdom come, your will be done, on earth as it is in heaven...

text: What does Jesus teach about worry and anxiety in Matthew 6?
options: Seek first the kingdom of God, and do not be anxious about tomorrow
verseText: But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you. “Therefore do not be anxious about tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself.

text: What principle does Jesus teach about judging others in Matthew 7?
options: Judge not, that you be not judged
verseText: “Judge not, that you be not judged.

text: What is the 'Golden Rule' as stated by Jesus in Matthew 7?
options: 'Whatever you wish that others would do to you, do also to them'
verseText: “So whatever you wish that others would do to you, do also to them, for this is the Law and the Prophets.

text: Jesus contrasts the wise and foolish builders in Matthew 7. What is the foundation of the wise builder?
options: Hearing and doing Jesus' words (the rock)
verseText: “Everyone then who hears these words of mine and does them will be like a wise man who built his house on the rock.

text: What amazed the crowds about Jesus' teaching at the end of the Sermon on the Mount (Matthew 7)?
options: He taught as one who had authority, not like their scribes
verseText: And when Jesus finished these sayings, the crowds were astonished at his teaching, for he was teaching them as one who had authority, and not as their scribes.

text: What Roman officer showed great faith, asking Jesus to heal his servant just by speaking a word (Matthew 8)?
verseText: But the centurion replied, “Lord, I am not worthy to have you come under my roof, but only say the word, and my servant will be healed.”... When Jesus heard this, he marveled and said to those who followed him, “Truly, I tell you, with no one in Israel have I found such faith.

text: What question did John the Baptist's disciples ask Jesus on John's behalf (Matthew 11)?
options: 'Are you the one who is to come, or shall we look for another?'
'Who is the greatest in the kingdom?'
verseText: Now when John heard in prison about the deeds of the Christ, he sent word by his disciples and said to him, “Are you the one who is to come, or shall we look for another?”

text: Jesus pronounced 'woes' on which Galilean cities for not repenting despite his mighty works there (Matthew 11)?
verseText: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago... And you, Capernaum, will you be exalted to heaven? You will be brought down to Hades.

text: What did Jesus say about the Sabbath when his disciples were criticized for plucking grain (Matthew 12)?
options: The Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath; it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath
Only priests could work on the Sabbath
They should have waited until evening
verseText: For the Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath... So it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.”

text: What is the 'unforgivable sin' mentioned by Jesus in Matthew 12?
verseText: Therefore I tell you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven people, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven... whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, either in this age or in the age to come.

text: Matthew 13 contains several parables about what?
verseText: He answered them, “To you it has been given to know the secrets of the kingdom of heaven...” He put another parable before them, saying, “The kingdom of heaven may be compared to a man who sowed good seed...”

text: In the Parable of the Sower (Matthew 13), what does the seed represent?
verseText: When anyone hears the word of the kingdom and does not understand it, the evil one comes and snatches away what has been sown in his heart. This is what was sown along the path.

text: What happened to John the Baptist according to Matthew 14?
options: He was beheaded by Herod Antipas
verseText: and he sent and had John beheaded in the prison, and his head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.

text: How many people did Jesus feed with five loaves and two fish, besides women and children (Matthew 14)?
verseText: And those who ate were about five thousand men, besides women and children.

text: Jesus criticized the Pharisees for honoring God with their lips while their hearts were far from Him, and for nullifying God's word for the sake of what (Matthew 15)?
verseText: So for the sake of your tradition you have made void the word of God... “‘This people honors me with their lips, but their heart is far from me; in vain do they worship me, teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’”

text: What event, where Jesus' appearance changed and he talked with Moses and Elijah, occurred on a high mountain (Matthew 17)?
verseText: And after six days Jesus took with him Peter and James, and John his brother, and led them up a high mountain by themselves. And he was transfigured before them... And behold, there appeared to them Moses and Elijah, talking with him.

text: How did Jesus instruct Peter to pay the temple tax for both of them (Matthew 17)?
options: Catch a fish, and find a coin in its mouth
verseText: However, not to give offense to them, go to the sea and cast a hook and take the first fish that comes up, and when you open its mouth you will find a shekel. Take that and give it to them for me and for yourself.”

text: What does Jesus teach about greatness in the Kingdom of Heaven, using a child as an example (Matthew 18)?
options: One must become humble like a child
verseText: and said, “Truly, I say to you, unless you turn and become like children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven. Whoever humbles himself like this child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

text: How many times did Jesus tell Peter he should forgive his brother (Matthew 18)?
verseText: Then Peter came up and said to him, “Lord, how often will my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? As many as seven times?” Jesus said to him, “I do not say to you seven times, but seventy-seven times.

text: What did Jesus say about divorce in Matthew 19, referencing Genesis?
options: It is permissible for any reason
God intended marriage to be permanent ('what God has joined together, let not man separate')
verseText: He answered, “Have you not read that he who created them from the beginning made them male and female, and said, ‘Therefore a man shall leave his father and his mother and hold fast to his wife, and the two shall become one flesh’? So they are no longer two but one flesh. What therefore God has joined together, let not man separate.”

text: What did Jesus tell the rich young ruler he still lacked after claiming to keep the commandments (Matthew 19)?
options: To sell his possessions, give to the poor, and follow Jesus
verseText: Jesus said to him, “If you would be perfect, go, sell what you possess and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me.”

text: How did Jesus enter Jerusalem during his Triumphal Entry (Matthew 21)?
options: Riding on a donkey and a colt
verseText: “Say to the daughter of Zion, ‘Behold, your king is coming to you, humble, and mounted on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a beast of burden.’”... They brought the donkey and the colt and put on them their cloaks, and he sat on them.

text: What did Jesus do in the temple courts after his Triumphal Entry (Matthew 21)?
options: Drove out the money changers and sellers
verseText: And Jesus entered the temple and drove out all who sold and bought in the temple, and he overturned the tables of the money-changers and the seats of those who sold pigeons.

text: In the Parable of the Wicked Tenants (Matthew 21), who do the tenants represent?
options: The religious leaders of Israel who rejected God's prophets and Son
verseText: Therefore I tell you, the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people producing its fruits... When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they perceived that he was speaking about them.

text: When asked about paying taxes to Caesar, what was Jesus' famous reply (Matthew 22)?
options: 'Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's'
verseText: They said, “Caesar's.” Then he said to them, “Therefore render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's.”

text: What did Jesus say are the two greatest commandments (Matthew 22)?
options: Keep the Sabbath and honor parents
Do not murder and do not steal
Love God with all your heart, soul, mind; and love your neighbor as yourself
Believe in Jesus and be baptized
verseText: And he said to him, “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind. This is the great and first commandment. And a second is like it: You shall love your neighbor as yourself. On these two commandments depend all the Law and the Prophets.”

text: In Matthew 23, Jesus pronounces seven 'woes' against whom?
verseText: “But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you shut the kingdom of heaven in people's faces...

text: What future event is the main subject of the Olivet Discourse in Matthew 24-25?
options: The destruction of Jerusalem and the return of Christ
verseText: But he answered them, “You see all these, do you not? Truly, I say to you, there will not be left here one stone upon another that will not be thrown down.” As he sat on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately, saying, “Tell us, when will these things be, and what will be the sign of your coming and of the end of the age?”... Then will appear in heaven the sign of the Son of Man...

text: In the Parable of the Sheep and the Goats (Matthew 25), on what basis are people separated?
options: How they treated the 'least of these' (representing Christ)
verseText: And the King will answer them, ‘Truly, I say to you, as you did it to one of the least of these my brothers, you did it to me.’... Then he will answer them, saying, ‘Truly, I say to you, as you did not do it to one of the least of these, you did not do it to me.’

text: Which disciple agreed to betray Jesus to the chief priests (Matthew 26)?
verseText: Then one of the twelve, whose name was Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests and said, “What will you give me if I deliver him over to you?” And they paid him thirty pieces of silver. And from that moment he sought an opportunity to betray him.

text: What did Jesus institute during the Last Supper with his disciples (Matthew 26)?
verseText: Now as they were eating, Jesus took bread, and after blessing it broke it and gave it to the disciples, and said, “Take, eat; this is my body.” And he took a cup, and when he had given thanks he gave it to them, saying, “Drink of it, all of you, for this is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.

text: Where did Jesus pray intensely before his arrest, asking 'let this cup pass from me' (Matthew 26)?
verseText: Then Jesus went with them to a place called Gethsemane... And going a little farther he fell on his face and prayed, saying, “My Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass from me; nevertheless, not as I will, but as you will.”

text: Which disciple denied Jesus three times before the rooster crowed (Matthew 26)?
verseText: Then he began to invoke a curse on himself and to swear, “I do not know the man.” And immediately the rooster crowed. And Peter remembered the saying of Jesus, “Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.” And he went out and wept bitterly.

text: What happened to Judas Iscariot after betraying Jesus (Matthew 27)?
options: He became a leader in the church
He repented, returned the money, and hanged himself
verseText: Then when Judas, his betrayer, saw that Jesus was condemned, he changed his mind and brought back the thirty pieces of silver... saying, “I have sinned by betraying innocent blood.”... And throwing down the pieces of silver into the temple, he departed, and he went and hanged himself.

text: What choice did the crowd make when Pilate offered to release either Jesus or Barabbas (Matthew 27)?
verseText: The governor again said to them, “Which of the two do you want me to release for you?” And they said, “Barabbas.”

text: Who was compelled to carry Jesus' cross (Matthew 27)?
verseText: As they went out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name. They compelled this man to carry his cross.

text: What inscription was placed above Jesus' head on the cross (Matthew 27)?
options: 'This is Jesus, the King of the Jews'
verseText: And over his head they put the charge against him, which read, “This is Jesus, the King of the Jews.”

text: What did Jesus cry out from the cross, meaning 'My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?' (Matthew 27)?
options: 'Into your hands I commit my spirit'
verseText: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani?” that is, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”

text: Who asked Pilate for Jesus' body and buried it in his own new tomb (Matthew 27)?
verseText: When it was evening, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who also was a disciple of Jesus. He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus... And Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a clean linen shroud and laid it in his own new tomb, which he had cut in the rock.

text: What precaution did the chief priests and Pharisees take regarding Jesus' tomb (Matthew 27)?
options: They asked Pilate to secure it with a guard and a seal
verseText: Therefore order the tomb to be made secure until the third day... Pilate said to them, “You have a guard of soldiers. Go, make it as secure as you can.” So they went and made the tomb secure by sealing the stone and setting a guard.

text: Who were the first people to discover the empty tomb on resurrection morning, according to Matthew 28?
options: Mary Magdalene and the other Mary
verseText: Now after the Sabbath, toward the dawn of the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to see the tomb.

text: What story did the chief priests bribe the guards to tell about the empty tomb (Matthew 28)?
options: They fell asleep and the disciples stole the body
verseText: And when they had assembled with the elders and taken counsel, they gave a sufficient sum of money to the soldiers and said, “Tell people, ‘His disciples came by night and stole him away while we were asleep.’”

text: Where did Jesus tell the disciples (through the women/angel) to go to meet him after the resurrection (Matthew 28)?
verseText: Then go quickly and tell his disciples that he has risen from the dead, and behold, he is going before you to Galilee; there you will see him... Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid; go and tell my brothers to go to Galilee, and there they will see me.”

text: How many generations does Matthew list in his genealogy from Abraham to David, David to the exile, and the exile to Christ (Matthew 1)?
verseText: So all the generations from Abraham to David were fourteen generations, and from David to the deportation to Babylon fourteen generations, and from the deportation to Babylon to the Christ fourteen generations.

text: Which four women (besides Mary) are mentioned in Jesus' genealogy in Matthew 1, unusual for the time?
options: Tamar, Rahab, Ruth, the wife of Uriah (Bathsheba)
verseText: ...and Judah the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar... and Salmon the father of Boaz by Rahab, and Boaz the father of Obed by Ruth, and Obed the father of Jesse, and Jesse the father of David the king. And David was the father of Solomon by the wife of Uriah.

text: What specific prophecy does Matthew quote regarding Jesus being called a Nazarene (Matthew 2)?
options: Matthew states 'spoken by the prophets,' without a specific OT quote
verseText: And he went and lived in a city called Nazareth, so that what was spoken by the prophets might be fulfilled, that he would be called a Nazarene. (No single OT verse says this directly; likely a summary or wordplay).

text: What harsh term did John the Baptist use for the Pharisees and Sadducees who came to his baptism (Matthew 3)?
verseText: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said to them, “You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?”

text: In the Sermon on the Mount, Jesus says that our righteousness must exceed that of whom to enter the kingdom (Matthew 5)?
verseText: For I tell you, unless your righteousness exceeds that of the scribes and Pharisees, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.

text: What illustration does Jesus use to warn against hypocrisy when judging others (Matthew 7)?
options: Trying to remove a speck from a brother's eye while having a log in your own
verseText: Why do you see the speck that is in your brother's eye, but do not notice the log that is in your own eye? ... You hypocrite, first take the log out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to take the speck out of your brother's eye.

text: What profession did Matthew (also called Levi) have before Jesus called him (Matthew 9)?
verseText: As Jesus passed on from there, he saw a man called Matthew sitting at the tax booth, and he said to him, “Follow me.” And he rose and followed him.

text: When commissioning the Twelve (Matthew 10), Jesus initially told them NOT to go to whom?
verseText: These twelve Jesus sent out, instructing them, “Go nowhere among the Gentiles and enter no town of the Samaritans, but go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

text: What did Jesus promise his disciples they would face when he sent them out (Matthew 10)?
options: Persecution ('like sheep in the midst of wolves')
verseText: “Behold, I am sending you out as sheep in the midst of wolves... and you will be hated by all for my name's sake.

text: In the Parable of the Weeds (Matthew 13), who sows the good seed and who sows the weeds?
options: The Son of Man and the devil
verseText: He answered, “The one who sows the good seed is the Son of Man. The field is the world, and the good seed is the sons of the kingdom. The weeds are the sons of the evil one, and the enemy who sowed them is the devil.

text: What authority did Jesus give Peter after his confession in Matthew 16?
options: The keys of the kingdom of heaven (binding and loosing)
verseText: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven, and whatever you bind on earth shall be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.”

text: What did Jesus teach about paying taxes using the illustration of a coin with Caesar's image (Matthew 22)?
options: Allegiance is owed only to God
Both earthly and divine authorities have legitimate claims
Only religious taxes should be paid
verseText: “Show me the coin for the tax.” And they brought him a denarius. And Jesus said to them, “Whose likeness and inscription is this?” They said, “Caesar's.” Then he said to them, “Therefore render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's.”

text: In the Olivet Discourse, Jesus warns about false Christs and false prophets who will show great signs and wonders to do what (Matthew 24)?
verseText: For false christs and false prophets will arise and perform great signs and wonders, so as to lead astray, if possible, even the elect.

text: What sign did Judas use to identify Jesus to the arresting mob (Matthew 26)?
verseText: Now the betrayer had given them a sign, saying, “The one I will kiss is the man; seize him.” And he came up to Jesus at once and said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” And he kissed him.

text: What did the Roman centurion and those with him say after witnessing Jesus' death and the accompanying events (Matthew 27)?
options: 'Truly this was the Son of God!'
verseText: When the centurion and those who were with him, keeping watch over Jesus, saw the earthquake and what took place, they were filled with awe and said, “Truly this was the Son of God!”
